info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 22 at 6:58PM CDT until March 22 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...Critical Fire Danger Conditions Expected Today... .Northwest winds of 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph will continue this early evening. Relative humidity will fall to 25 to 35 percent for the coastal regions of the southern Coastal Bend to 15 to 25 percent Brush Country. Conditions are expected to improve this evening as winds decrease and humidity values increase. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN COASTAL BEND TO BRUSH COUNTRY... * TIMING...Through 9 PM. * WIND...Northwest 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...25 to 35 percent coastal region of southern Coastal Bend to 15 to 25 percent Brush Country. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.
